Remarks. This is a west Palaearctic species distributed in Europe, European Russia , Georgia , Azerbaijan , Turkey and Iran . In Turkey , the species was previously known from Ordu , Hatay , Istanbul , Mersin and Sinop provinces (Horion 1963; Smetana 1967 ; Assing 2010 ; Bordoni 2010 ). The species was recorded from Crimea by Gusarov (1989) . From the Caucasus it was recorded by Luze (1903) without an exact locality and by Roubal (1913) for Teberda. It was recorded by Jakobson (1908) for Elizavetpol` (‘Елизаветп[оль].’, now Gyandzha, Azerbaijan ). In the present study,
L. punctata
is recorded from Izmir , Artvin , Erzurum , Tunceli and Kars provinces of Turkey , from the Rostov Area of Russia , from Georgia and from Iran for the first time.
